name: catch crop growing, ryegrass-Egyptian&Persian clover-mixture, August-October, organic fertiliser 30 kg N, one cut | ryegrass-Egyptian&Persian clover-mixture silage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4733/documentation

This dataset represents the cultivation of ryegrass-Egyptian&Persian clover-mixture silage on an area of 1 ha. The dry matter yield is 1953 kg/ha. The moisture content of the silage at storage is 65%.

This activity starts after the harvest of the previous crop. The input of seeds is included. Farm manure as an organic fertiliser - if applied - is only accounted for in terms of direct field emissions; all pre-processes are included in the animal production systems.


The dataset includes all machine operations and corresponding machine infrastructure and sheds. Machine operations are: soil cultivation, sowing, manuring - if manure is applied -, mowing, haying, swathing, baling, bale loading and transport of silage bales to the farm. Further, direct field emissions are included. This activity ends after the transport of the bales to the farm at the farm gate.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data collected from literature and expert knowledge; some own estimates.

exchanges.description: Dry matter yield per hectare; calculated based on Lehmann (1991): dry matter yield at 25 kg N/ha; 10% of silage loss are subtracted (Agridea 2007). --- Sources: AGRIDEA (2007) Landwirtschaftliches Handbuch Pflanzen und Tiere. Wirz Kalender, 2007. Ed. AGRIDEA, Lindau (Switzerland).

flow.name: ryegrass-Egyptian&Persian clover-mixture silage
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

exchanges.description: Modelled, see chapter 'Emissions of heavy metals to agricultural soil, surface water and ground water' in '01_crop production_direct field emissions and natural resources_v1.0.pdf' - pdf-document on the dedicated talk page of ecoinvent (www.ecoinvent.org/documentation)

Assumption based on the number of cuts and current practice in Switzerland (cf. Boessinger et. al 2004)
This exchange has an activity link directly to the producing activity because the product is primarily consumed in the same geographical area where it is produced.
